pros: The greatest hospital of Taiwan
cons: Very busy and exhausting, you won't be pay if overtime

pros: Good pay compared with others local hospital
cons: More critical and complicated patients so would need more efforts and not easy (not bad still)

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Southlake, TX
pros: 1. It’s the most reputed hospital in Taiwan. 2. Rich resources and stable working environment. 3. Nice co-worker and flexible hours 4. Great place for fresh graduate
cons: 1. Lack of efficiency and incentive for its employees. 2. The old building were not designed as a research facility which made employees gave ways to their safety (eg. eating near lab bench, use normal hallway to ship bio-hazarded waste instead of a separated route) 3. Poor management

pros: A hospital with a very good reputation in Taiwan. Nice staff and nice working environment.
cons: Pay less than average. Requires research paper publishing to keep in the position.

pros: You will be able to learn structurally and comprehensively.
cons: You will need to get used to the inefficient way the whole old system is working. The leader here cared about responsibility. You can expect no personal life ever after.

pros: Honor complete high tech , care well
cons: Busy,hard. Need promotion continuously paper work many

pros: NTUH has a good and practicable system for staff to work.
cons: There's a high pressure on the hospital work in NTUH, and always needs speed, speed, and speed. But that's why NTUH is a strong hospital and provide ecellect service.

pros: good at skill training and technology.

pros: Very good work place and environment

pros: High quality personnel and equipment
cons: Low salary and redundant work

review_title: A good place to go if your major is Hospital Management
pros: A hospital with good reputation. Easy to find medical resources once you and your family need medical care.
cons: Boring work. Everything is so routine. Employees in this hospital have been divided into two kinds. One is as pubic servants who have very high salary and full bonus. But the rest are contract employees hired by hospital. In contrast, those contract employees have relatively low salary and poor bonus even though their loading is the same. Most public servants in this hospital can be promoted to supervisors or management board, but the chance for the contract ones is rare.

pros: Excellent research environment with all facilities at one place.....well funded projects so no shortage of money for research.. but need to do hard work to get funds...its really difficult but not impossible....I received two grants of 30 million NTD twice....
cons: sometime language is a barrier...most of the colleagues speaks Chinese. all documentation is in chinese always need to ask someone who can help for translation or to fill any application form....

review_title: Wealth of resources at hands, but the career has somewhat gloomy future
pros:
1. Comprehensive online academic resources provided by the library
2. Higher prevalence of complicated symptom presentation and rare diseases, providing ideal training environment for residents
3. Versatile faculties
cons:
1. Low salary compared with private practice facilities
2. Extended working hours
3. Overwhelming printed documentation due to patient quality promotion
4. Relatively isolated recruitment policy for medical staff

pros: Easier to acquire the latest treatment and full assessment for some rare diseases
cons:
incredibly high working hours
hostile occupational atmosphere
very low salary
too much unnecessary paper work

pros: If your PI is good, then you are fine. This position is also good for applying for PhD afterwards.
cons: If the PI is not that good, then you are in trouble. The salary is a bit low given the skills it required.

pros: You can learn the hospital information system here. You can learn how to do SA, SD, coding and customer service all here. If you work overtime, you can get compensatory or overtime pay.
cons: Bad loading balance. Bad management system for Information Office.

pros:
